verses.text: And Hannah prayed, and said, My heart rejoiceth in the \sc Lord\sc*, Mine horn is exalted in the \sc Lord\sc*: My mouth is enlarged over mine enemies; Because I rejoice in thy salvation.
\add There is\add* none holy as the \sc Lord\sc*: For \add there is\add* none beside thee: Neither \add is there\add* any rock like our God.
Talk no more \add so\add* exceeding proudly; Let \add not\add* arrogancy come out of your mouth: For the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* a God of knowledge, And by him actions are weighed.
The bows of the mighty \add men are\add* broken, And they that stumbled are girt with strength.
\add They that were\add* full have hired out themselves for bread; And \add they that were\add* hungry ceased: So that the barren hath born seven; And she that hath many children is waxed feeble.
The \sc Lord\sc* killeth, and maketh alive: He bringeth down \add to\add* the grave, and bringeth up.
The \sc Lord\sc* maketh poor, and maketh rich: He bringeth low, and lifteth up.

He raiseth up the poor out of the dust, \add And\add* lifteth up the beggar from the dunghill, To set \add them\add* among princes, And to make them inherit the throne of glory: For the pillars of the earth \add are\add* the \sc Lord’s\sc*, And he hath set the world upon them.
He will keep the feet of his saints, And the wicked shall be silent in darkness; For by strength shall no man prevail.

The adversaries of the \sc Lord\sc* shall be broken to pieces; Out of heaven shall he thunder upon them: The \sc Lord\sc* shall judge the ends of the earth; And he shall give strength unto his king, And exalt the horn of his anointed.
And Elkanah went to Ramah to his house. And the child did minister unto the \sc Lord\sc* before Eli the priest.
Now the sons of Eli \add were\add* sons of Belial; they knew not the \sc Lord\sc*.
And the priests’ custom with the people \add was, that\add* when any man offered sacrifice, the priest’s servant came, while the flesh was in seething, with a fleshhook of three teeth in his hand;

and he strooke \add it\add* into the pan, or kettle, or caldron, or pot; all that the fleshhook brought up the priest took for himself. So they did in Shiloh unto all the Israelites that came thither.
Also before they burnt the fat, the priest’s servant came, and said to the man that sacrificed, Give flesh to roast for the priest; for he will not have sodden flesh of thee, but raw.

And \add if any\add* man said unto him, Let them not fail to burn the fat presently, and \add then\add* take \add as much\add* as thy soul desireth; then he would answer him, \add Nay;\add* but thou shalt give \add it me\add* now: and if not, I will take \add it\add* by force.
Wherefore the sin of the young men was very great before the \sc Lord\sc*: for men abhorred the offering of the \sc Lord\sc*.
But Samuel ministered before the \sc Lord\sc*, \add being\add* a child, girded \add with\add* a linen ephod.
Moreover his mother made him a little coat, and brought \add it\add* to him from year to year, when she came up with her husband to offer the yearly sacrifice.
And Eli blessed Elkanah and his wife, and said, The \sc Lord\sc* give thee seed of this woman for the loan which is lent to the \sc Lord\sc*. And they went unto their own home.
And the \sc Lord\sc* visited Hannah, so that she conceived, and bare three sons and two daughters. And the child Samuel grew before the \sc Lord\sc*.
Now Eli was very old, and heard all that his sons did unto all Israel; and how they lay with the women that assembled \add at\add* the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
And he said unto them, Why do ye such things? for I hear of your evil dealings by all this people.
Nay, my sons; for \add it is\add* no good report that I hear: \add ye\add* make the \sc Lord’s\sc* people to transgress.

If one man sin against another, the judge shall judge him: but if a man sin against the \sc Lord\sc*, who shall intreat for him? Notwithstanding they hearkened not unto the voice of their father, because the \sc Lord\sc* would slay them.
And the child Samuel grew on, and was in favour both with the \sc Lord\sc*, and also with men.
And there came a man of God unto Eli, and said unto him, Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, Did I plainly appear unto the house of thy father, when they were in Egypt in Pharaoh’s house?

And did I choose him out of all the tribes of Israel to be my priest, to offer upon mine altar, to burn incense, to wear an ephod before me? and did I give unto the house of thy father all the offerings made by fire of the children of Israel?

Wherefore kick ye at my sacrifice and at mine offering, which I have commanded \add in my\add* habitation; and honourest thy sons above me, to make yourselves fat with the chiefest of all the offerings of Israel my people?

Wherefore the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel saith, I said indeed \add that\add* thy house, and the house of thy father, should walk before me for ever: but now the \sc Lord\sc* saith, Be it far from me; for them that honour me I will honour, and they that despise me shall be lightly esteemed.
Behold, the days come, that I will cut off thine arm, and the arm of thy father’s house, that there shall not be an old man in thine house.
And thou shalt see an enemy \add in my\add* habitation, in all \add the wealth\add* which \add God\add* shall give Israel: and there shall not be an old man in thine house for ever.

And the man of thine, \add whom\add* I shall not cut off from mine altar, \add shall be\add* to consume thine eyes, and to grieve thine heart: and all the increase of thine house shall die in the flower of their age.
And this \add shall be\add* a sign unto thee, that shall come upon thy two sons, on Hophni and Phinehas; in one day they shall die both of them.

And I will raise me up a faithful priest, \add that\add* shall do according to \add that\add* which \add is\add* in my heart and in my mind: and I will build him a sure house; and he shall walk before mine anointed for ever.

And it shall come to pass, \add that\add* every one that is left in thine house shall come and crouch to him for a piece of silver and a morsel of bread, and shall say, Put me, I pray thee, into one of the priests’ offices, that \add I\add* may eat a piece of bread.
